00026 #include "lpc17xx_libcfg.h"
00027 #include "lpc17xx_gpio.h"
00028 #include "lpc17xx_systick.h"
00029 
00030 /* Example group ----------------------------------------------------------- */
00036 /************************** PRIVATE VARIABLES *************************/
00037 FunctionalState Cur_State = ENABLE;
00038 
00039 /************************** PRIVATE FUNCTIONS *************************/
00040 void SysTick_Handler(void);
00041 
00042 /*----------------- INTERRUPT SERVICE ROUTINES --------------------------*/
00043 /*********************************************************************/
00048 void SysTick_Handler(void)
00049 {
00050         //Clear System Tick counter flag
00051         SYSTICK_ClearCounterFlag();
00052         //toggle P0.0
00053         if (Cur_State == ENABLE)
00054         {
00055                 //pull-down pin
00056                 GPIO_ClearValue(0, (1<<0));
00057                 Cur_State = DISABLE;
00058         }
00059         else
00060         {
00061                 GPIO_SetValue(0, (1<<0));
00062                 Cur_State = ENABLE;
00063         }
00064 }
00065 
00066 
00067 /*-------------------------MAIN FUNCTION------------------------------*/
00068 /*********************************************************************/
00073 int c_entry (void)
00074 {
00075         //Use P0.0 to test System Tick interrupt
00076         GPIO_SetDir(0, (1<<0), 1); //Set P0.0 as output
00077 
00078         //Initialize System Tick with 10ms time interval
00079         SYSTICK_InternalInit(10);
00080         //Enable System Tick interrupt
00081         SYSTICK_IntCmd(ENABLE);
00082         //Enable System Tick Counter
00083         SYSTICK_Cmd(ENABLE);
00084 
00085         while(1);
00086         return 1;
00087 }
00088 
00089 
00090 /* With ARM and GHS toolsets, the entry point is main() - this will
00091    allow the linker to generate wrapper code to setup stacks, allocate
00092    heap area, and initialize and copy code and data segments. For GNU
00093    toolsets, the entry point is through __start() in the crt0_gnu.asm
00094    file, and that startup code will setup stacks and data */
00095 int main(void)
00096 {
00097     return c_entry();
00098 }

00109 {
00110         /* User can add his own implementation to report the file name and line number,
00111          ex: printf("Wrong parameters value: file %s on line %d\r\n", file, line) */
00112

00114         while(1);
